title: Senior Backend Software Engineer
description:
A few things about Orfium

In Orfium we are building the digital future of the Music and Media Industry, by providing complete solutions to generate and manage their revenue, promote their content and analyze their business.

YouTube, Spotify, Apple, Netflix, and various other platforms have changed the experience of the audience. On our part, we are building the technology to find content in digital platforms, recognize it and match it with the catalogs of the owners. We are developing solutions based on Big Data, Machine Learning, and Business Intelligence to provide Enterprise services and complete SaaS solutions.

Orfium currently serves some of the biggest clients in Entertainment, as the leading Copyrights Management and Information Technology company. With our HQ in Malibu, CA and our R&D department in Athens, Greece, we are able to serve the biggest markets while we innovate fast.

If you believe you can make a difference by joining one of the fastest-growing tech companies in the world, you should definitely apply!


WHAT WE NEED

We are looking for a Senior Django Backend Engineer to join our Greek branch in Koukaki, Athens.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

You will be part of an Agile Team and will:

  • Maintain as well as build new features for our B2B products.
  • Participate in team meetings and propose solutions.
  • Code Review your collaborators' code(everyone does it).
  • Properly document your work by both technical and/or business perspective.
requirements:
NEEDED SKILLS

  • At least 4+ years of working experience in creating and maintaining software systems in production environments.
  • At least 2 years of working experience with Django or a modern Web Development Framework.
  • Experience in Test-Driven Development (TDD).
  • Hands-On SQL Experience(preferably with PostgreSQL).
  • Ability to write organised and clean code.
  • Good understanding of Version Control (preferably with Git).
  • Understanding of Modern System Architectures, Design Patterns, Data Structures.
  • Willingness to continuously learn and become better.
  • Ability to work as part of a team.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Good written and verbal communication skills in English.


EXTRA POINTS:

  • Expertise in Django/Django REST Framework.
  • Familiarity with AWS.
  • Experience with ElasticSearch.
  • Experience with consuming third-party APIs.
  • Love for music.

title: Music Copyrights Specialist I
description:
Company Summary:

Orfium is a fast-growing music technology company representing some of the biggest music companies in the world. We are looking for talented, hardworking people to join our rights management team who are passionate about protecting the value of music. Our office is located in Malibu, CA with a beautiful ocean view overlooking the Malibu Pier. Some of our clients include: Warner Music Group, Sony Music Group, Sony/ATV Music Publishing, Warner Chappell Music Publishing, Global Music Rights, Ingrooves, Red Bull, and many more.

Position Summary: The Music Copyrights Specialist is responsible for identifying and claiming videos that indicate copyright music/infringement through Youtube’s content management system (CMS). This role requires the analysis of music and revenue data as well staying up to date with industry trends in entertainment. This is a entry-level professional with limited prior experience, but can learn to use professional concepts to resolve problems of limited scope and complexity.
requirements:
Duties/Responsibilities:

  • Employees are expected to acquire the skills and knowledge necessary to perform work necessary for the role through defined training and development planning.
  • Analyze music on a harmonic, melodic, lyrical, and sonic level.
  • Extreme attention to detail, data-driven, excellent communication skills, and a self-starter.
  • Identify and claim videos using copyrighted music through YouTube’s content management system.
  • Support the policing of piracy and copyright infringement by monitoring the unauthorized exploitation of our clients’ copyrights.
  • Remain up to date with industry topics and music.
  • Collect and analyze revenue data to discover valuable content for our clients.
  • Other duties that may be assigned to help the company meet goals.
  • Growth opportunities within this role based on performance
  • Employees should perform at a minimum, milestone 1 for a minimum of 12 months from date of hire as designated by their manager.
  • Perform other duties and responsibilities, as assigned.

Qualifications:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills; extremely detail-oriented.
  • Exhibits professional demeanor and sound judgment.
  • Follows up on delegated assignments through completion.
  • Self-starter, who takes initiative and is resourceful; takes ownership of tasks and projects.
  • Ability to adjust to changes of the industry, new guidelines made either internally or by our clients
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize; works well under pressure.
  • Ability to work autonomously and collaboratively.
  • Excellent typing and computer skills, including in Word, Excel, Outlook.
  • Advanced computer experience: Microsoft WordExcel, Internet search, Google trends.
  • Intermediate musical experience with an exceptional ear.
  • High school diploma required, preferred BA or BS degree from an accredited college or university.

Supervisory Responsibilities:

This position does not directly supervise.

Essential Work & Physical Requirements:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear.

  • Available to work a minimum of 40 hours per week and a minimum of 5 days per week.
  • Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
  • Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.


Orfium is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

description:
A few things about Orfium

In Orfium we are building the digital future of the Music and Media Industry, by providing complete solutions to generate and manage their revenue, promote their content and analyze their business.

YouTube, Spotify, Apple, Netflix, and various other platforms have changed the experience of the audience. On our part, we are building the technology to find content in digital platforms, recognize it and match it with the catalogs of the owners. We are developing solutions based on Big Data, Machine Learning, and Business Intelligence to provide Enterprise services and complete SaaS solutions.

Orfium currently serves some of the biggest clients in Entertainment, as the leading Copyrights Management and Information Technology company. With our HQ in Malibu, CA and our R&D department in Athens, Greece, we are able to serve the biggest markets while we innovate fast.

If you believe you can make a difference by joining one of the fastest-growing tech companies in the world, you should definitely apply!


WHAT WE NEED

We are looking for a Mid Django Backend Engineer to join our Greek branch in Koukaki, Attica.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

You will be part of an Agile Team and will:

  • Maintain as well as build new features for our B2B products.

  • Properly document your work by both technical and/or business perspective.
requirements:

  • At least 2-3 years of working experience in creating and maintaining software systems in production environments.
  • At least 1 year of working experience with Django or a modern Web Development Framework.

  • Hands-On SQL Experience(preferably with PostgreSQL).
  • Ability to write organised and clean code.
  • Good understanding of Version Control (preferably with Git).
  • Understanding of Modern System Architectures, Design Patterns, Data Structures.
  • Willingness to continuously learn and become better.

  • Love for music.

title: Software Engineering Team Leader / "Tech Lead"
description:
A few things about Orfium

In Orfium we are building the digital future of the Music and Media Industry, by providing complete solutions to generate and manage their revenue, promote their content and analyze their business.

YouTube, Spotify, Apple, Netflix, and various other platforms have changed the experience of the audience. On our part, we are building the technology to find content in digital platforms, recognize it and match it with the catalogs of the owners. We are developing solutions based on Big Data, Machine Learning, and Business Intelligence to provide Enterprise services and complete SaaS solutions.

Orfium currently serves some of the biggest clients in Entertainment, as the leading Copyrights Management and Information Technology company. With our HQ in Malibu, CA and our R&D department in Athens, Greece, we are able to serve the biggest markets while we innovate fast.

If you believe you can make a difference by joining one of the fastest-growing tech companies in the world, you should definitely apply!


WHAT WE NEED

We are looking for a Tech Lead to join our Greek branch in Koukaki, Athens (near the Syggrou Fix station).


WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

You will be leading an agile engineering team and will:

  • Drive architecture design and technical discussions within the engineering team.
  • Communicate with business, product, and operations departments.
  • Work closely with the leadership of the engineering department and other tech leads to realize our vision of making Orfium the primary technology provider of the music industry.
  • Ensure the delivery of the end product.
  • Motivate & coach team members while creating a nice atmosphere in the team.
  • Improve the quality of the end product by leading code reviews, assuring code quality, and promoting best practices.
  • Lead by example by contributing to the codebase yourself whenever possible.
  • Be willing to learn more & more about technology and engineering teams every day!
requirements:
NEEDED SKILLS

  • At least 4 years of working experience in creating and maintaining software systems in production environments.
  • At least 2 years of working experience either as a Backend or Frontend Web Development Framework (preferably with expertise in Django or ReactJS respectively).
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Ability to design and enforce engineering processes.
  • Deep understanding of Modern System Architectures, Design Patterns, Data Structures.
  • Willingness to continuously learn and become better.
  • Ability to lead an engineering team.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

EXTRA POINTS:

  • Previous experience in leading engineering teams.
  • Experience with AWS.
  • Experience with consuming third-party APIs.
  • Embrassing the DevOps culture.
  • Love for music.

title: Assistant Team Lead
description:
Company Summary:

Orfium is a fast-growing music technology company representing some of the biggest record labels and music publishers in the world. We are looking for talented, hard working people to join our rights management team who are growth-minded and are passionate about music. Our office is located in Malibu, CA with a beautiful ocean view overlooking the Malibu Pier. Some of our clients include Sony/ATV, EMI, Warner Chappell, Red Bull, and more.

Internal Applicants only!

Duties/Responsibilities:

  • Support claimers company-wide if they have questions about claims or account specifics.
  • Ensure claimer is aware of their daily responsibilities (creating video groups, updating revenue, filling out Claim Report at EOD).
  • Delegate tasks and set deadlines for the team in order to maximize efficiency with the guidance of Team Lead.
  • Communicate with Team Lead and team members daily and give feedback, whether that’s positive feedback or making a claimer aware that they need to improve performance
  • Monitor productivity and effectiveness of each team member throughout the day to ensure they’re utilizing good time management skills every day.
  • Checking direct reports claims daily, checking for mistakes, and using it as a resource to ensure claim follow-through.
  • Provide strong lead generation for the team, and send claimable content daily, as resources to teach claimers how to find valuable claimable content autonomously especially if they are struggling.
  • Work closely with Team Lead to gathers, analyze and report daily, weekly and monthly data from claimers to business unit leadership for maximum transparency and insight into performance.
  • If a claimer is starting to show poor performance, communicate and work with them to see why that might be and how we can improve.
  • Ensure claimers know how to utilize all available software and tools to maximize revenue.
  • Foster a healthy, positive team environment where each person feels comfortable sharing concerns about their performance with the team lead and also sharing leads with the other claimers should they find one.
  • Support Team Leads as needed
  • Perform other duties and responsibilities, as assigned.
requirements:
Qualifications:

  • Music Copyright experience a plus i.e. customer service, music instructor, supervisor
  • Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong supervisory and leadership skills
  • Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate.
  • Ability to function well in a high-paced and at times stressful environment.
  • Stay up to date with guidelines set by Orfium, the clients and industry partners
  • Advanced computer experience
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills; extremely detail-oriented
  • Extensive musical experience with an exceptional ear
  • Preferred BA or BS degree from an accredited college or university

Supervisory Responsibilities:

This position does indirectly supervise.

Essential Work & Physical Requirements:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear.

  • Available to work a minimum of 40 hours per week and a minimum of 5 days per week.
  • Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
  • Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.

Orfium is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Big Data Engineer
description:
A few things about Orfium

In Orfium we are building the digital future of the Music and Media Industry, by providing complete solutions to generate and manage their revenue, promote their content and analyze their business.

YouTube, Spotify, Apple, Netflix, and various other platforms have changed the experience of the audience. On our part, we are building the technology to find content in digital platforms, recognize it and match it with the catalogs of the owners. We are developing solutions based on Big Data, Machine Learning, and Business Intelligence to provide Enterprise services and complete SaaS solutions.

Orfium currently serves some of the biggest clients in Entertainment, as the leading Copyrights Management and Information Technology company. With our HQ in Malibu, CA and our R&D department in Athens, Greece, we are able to serve the biggest markets while we innovate fast.

If you believe you can make a difference by joining one of the fastest-growing tech companies in the world, you should definitely apply!


WHAT WE NEED

Do you love Big Data & Engineering within the AWS environment using Python, Athena & Presto? We are currently looking for a passionate and experienced Big Data Engineer to design and develop data-driven solutions.

You ‘get’ Big Data and Cloud computing and you have experience in handling vast amounts of data – working on database design and development, data integration and ingestion, designing ETL architectures using a variety of ETL tools and techniques.



What you will be doing

  • Big Data processing using NoSQL databases
  • Deploying data mining and implementing various machine learning (ML) models
  • Delivering data modeling and ETL practices
  • Architecting the infrastructure for Big Data lakes
  • Delivering data modeling and ETL practices
  • Deploying and maintaining Business Intelligence (BI) systems
  • Design, construction, tests, maintenance and optimization of cloud infrastructure for running large-scale data processing systems
  • Assistance to Data Scientists in implementing various ML models in order to allow the AI to process the data and discover hidden patterns and anomalies.
  • Deployment of various algorithms for normalization of disparate data to leverage various types of Big Data analytics
requirements:
NEEDED SKILLS


  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, or a related technical discipline
  • 5+ years of experience building and operating systems of data extraction, ingestion, and processing of large data sets
  • Solid experience with tools in the larger Python ecosystem (Pandas, Numpy, Jupyter etc.)
  • Ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete and/or dirty data
  • Demonstrated strength in data modelling, ETL development, and data warehousing
  • Knowledge of data management fundamentals and data storage principles
  • Familiarity with statistical models and/or data mining algorithms and practical experience of applying these to business problems
  • Fluency in English & Greek



The aforementioned skills and responsibilities require working with Big Data tools, languages and databases like Hadoop, MongoDB, Redis, Cassandra, Spark, Python, R, and others. Big Data Engineer works with so-called data lakes, namely huge storages and incoming streams of unstructured data.

The system architecture is flat, meaning all the images, texts and documents along with the other types of data are stored without any hierarchy to enable swift normalization. This ensures easy adaptation to any requirements of highly configurable machine learning algorithms.

title: Machine Learning QA Engineer
description:
A few things about Orfium

In Orfium we are building the digital future of the Music and Media Industry, by providing complete solutions to generate and manage their revenue, promote their content and analyze their business.

YouTube, Spotify, Apple, Netflix, and various other platforms have changed the experience of the audience. On our part, we are building the technology to find content in digital platforms, recognize it and match it with the catalogs of the owners. We are developing solutions based on Big Data, Machine Learning, and Business Intelligence to provide Enterprise services and complete SaaS solutions.

Orfium currently serves some of the biggest clients in Entertainment, as the leading Copyrights Management and Information Technology company. With our HQ in Malibu, CA and our R&D department in Athens, Greece, we are able to serve the biggest markets while we innovate fast.

If you believe you can make a difference by joining one of the fastest-growing tech companies in the world, you should definitely apply!


What we need

Machine Learning (ML) sits at the core of our efforts to automate future work. We turn ML lab experiments into enterprise-ready AI solutions to solve complex machine learning, deep learning and natural language understanding problems, and we’re looking for amazing people to join us. We're looking to grow our Machine Learning team with the addition of an ML QA Engineer. You will be working directly with our Data Scientists, Data Engineers, BI Analysts and ML Engineers Team, in Athens and will help them to test and improve our ML Products–Content Recognition Platform.

What you will be doing·

  • Help the teams to identify and resolve ML problems
  • Help Data Scientists with Data Annotation–labelling, and preparing datasets for training
  • Analyse performance results of the model
  • Execute end to end scenarios to verify that the model performs as expected
  • Create and write efficient manual and automation test cases
  • Develop custom tooling to automate workflows
  • Manage large, production-quality systems
  • Investigate and resolve technical issues across the full stack
requirements:
Needed skills

  • BS in Computer Science or similar.
  • 1-3 years of experience in relevant roles is a plus
  • Good problem-solving skills
  • Very good interpersonal skills
  • Proficient with Python and shell scripting
  • Experience with continuous deployment, and live monitoring in production
  • Experiment with implementation of security best practices
  • Experience using Git in a professional/workplace environment

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
A few things about Orfium

In Orfium we are building the digital future of the Music and Media Industry, by providing complete solutions to generate and manage their revenue, promote their content and analyze their business.

YouTube, Spotify, Apple, Netflix, and various other platforms have changed the experience of the audience. On our part, we are building the technology to find content in digital platforms, recognize it and match it with the catalogs of the owners. We are developing solutions based on Big Data, Machine Learning, and Business Intelligence to provide Enterprise services and complete SaaS solutions.

Orfium currently serves some of the biggest clients in Entertainment, as the leading Copyrights Management and Information Technology company. With our HQ in Malibu, CA and our R&D department in Athens, Greece, we are able to serve the biggest markets while we innovate fast.

If you believe you can make a difference by joining one of the fastest-growing tech companies in the world, you should definitely apply!


What we need

We are looking for a proactive and passionate BI Analyst to join our Business Intelligence and Analytics Team to help drive the understanding of complex data sets, translate business needs to technical specifications and support the Data Transformation of Orfium products suite, user acquisition & expansion. This person will have deep technical skills to complement their analytical experience and will be comfortable working with business partners to understand the business strategy and build out dashboards/scorecards–we work with Tableau, to provide insights for better decisions and self-serve for smarter operation. They will be solving business problems, collaborating across teams, and passionate about having a huge impact on a growing team.

What you will be doing

  • Collaborate across Finance, Operations, Product and Data Science to use data to generate insights.
  • Create and manage dashboards, scorecards, and other analytical services.
  • Develop analytics solutions that bring analytics to life by using design thinking concepts.
  • Design, build and automate key business metrics into one visualization to tell a fuller story.
  • Build processes and standards to build trust and provide consistent metrics across the organization.
requirements:
Needed skills

  • 3+ years of analytics experience, working with Finance teams, Product and or Data Science.
  • 3+ Years experience with modern analytics tools such as Tableau, or similar tools.
  • Solid experience in scripting with SQL, extracting large sets of data, and design of ETL flows.
  • A plus: Knowledge of cloud tools like AWS, Snowflake, Google Cloud.
  • Program management for business analysis and requirements gathering.
  • Design thinking concepts or other visualization concepts that drive story-telling.
  • Ability to operate as the point of contact for the business partner.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Science or similar.
